TopicTitle: We could see Kerbal on Next Gen consoles?

Articles.Content:
Could it happen?

Could we see Kerbal on Xbox One and Ps4? Both consoles have the specs to do it and also I think it will provide a bigger audience for building. I mean if the company does a KickStarter for it.. would you pay for it?

Me personally as seeing them as a Indie Game company, I think once they get a few more updates done on Pc. It would be nice to see them on Next Gen. It would be a nice change.

Just a random thought I had in my head for awhile now.

As posted on Kerbal Space Program subreddit: http://www.reddit.com/r/KerbalSpaceProgram/comments/1makw7/we_could_see_kerbal_on_next_gen_consoles/
The game doesn't really lend itself well to console controllers, though. They're fine when flying planes in-atmosphere but as soon as you get to space you start running out of buttons fast.

This topic has been talked about too much and spawns too much flame war.

Moderators, if you would, please.
Also, it's on the not to suggest list. Please look at that before you suggest ANYTHING

Both consoles have the specs to do it

uh...no they don't, their cpus would fall to their knees and beg for mercy.

Consoles can't run KSP practically due to

A.) The post above me

B.) You don't have enough buttons

C.) Computers > Consoles (inb4wars)

D.) It's a sandbox game. Sandbox games don't work all too well on Consoles, in my experience at least.

Consoles can't run KSP practically due to

A.) The post above me

B.) You don't have enough buttons

C.) Computers > Consoles (inb4wars)

D.) It's a sandbox game. Sandbox games don't work all too well on Consoles, in my experience at least.

Minecraft is a sandbox game. And it's on almost all consoles XBOX 360 and up.

Minecraft is a sandbox game. And it's on almost all consoles XBOX 360 and up.

That is true. I should've added "Most" before "Sandbox games". I completely forget MC is a thing at times (somehow). Still, I doubt a console can handle KSP too well.

Thread locked as it fall under the

Use of other hardware platforms or operating system types

of the What not to suggest list sticky.
